text: Pray for Storms
Pray for Calm Seas
Free the Daemon
Deny the Daemon
Counsel Temperance
Counsel Vengeance
Forgive the Elves
Condemn the Elves
Petition the Bretonnians
Petition the High Elves
Petition the Dwarfs
Petition the Empire
Devour the Godflesh
Trade the Godflesh
Cross the Threshold
The Time Is Not Right
I Care Not
Alberic offers his trident up to his god, vowing that he will continue to hunt Manann's enemies wherever the storms rage the hardest.
Falling to one knee, Alberic humbles himself before his god and prays for the safe passage of Bretonnia's fleets.
“You are free, daemon. Free to serve as my pack mule. Now go, search the corpses of the slain. Bring back anything of value you find.”
“I said I would set you free, mighty daemon. I never said when.”
Come sister, you have suffered enough in these foul wastes. Travel with me to the Paradise Gardens. Mother will be overjoyed at your return.
These foul daemons must pay for their transgressions! Fight alongside me, sister. Together, we will push them back to the very polar gates!
The Grudge is struck. The Witch King's veiled machinations have been laid bare for all to see. Let us reforge the old alliances and stand together as one against the coming darkness.

Malekith proved that the Elgi cannot be trusted. It is in their nature to lie and decieve, and the Dawi would be fools to forget this. The War of Vengeance will begin anew, and this time it will not end until we have their unconditional surrender. Muster the throngs - we march to Ulthuan!
The knights of fair Bretonnia are far removed from the grim troubles of the north, but they are ever hungry for glory and would surely jump at this chance to prove their valour.

The Elves of distant Ulthuan once came to Kislev's aid in her darkest hour. That time has come again. Though they are enamoured in a civil war that has lasted centuries, they may be willing to fight alongside us once more.

The Slayer King of Karak Kadrin is unlikely to march to our defence while his own hold is under constant assault from Greenskins and Vampires, but his death-seeking Slayers may be lured to our cause if we insist our situation is one of imminent doom.

We are the shield of the Empire, all that stands between them and the vast legions of Chaos. The squabbling Elector Counts would do well to remember that. It is in their mutual interest to lend us their support.

For long years, Throt's every thought, every deed, has been dominated by gnawing hunger. As the Mage-Queen's divine pulp reaches his broiling gut, his mind clears and turns immediately to the next foul experiment. Of the forests and those within, Throt cares not. Let Chaos take them.

As the Mage-Queen's divine pulp bubbles merrily in the cauldron, Throt considers whether hoarding the godflesh is in his clan's best interests. Surely other clans would pay a king's ransom to have even a single vial of the precious liquid...

I must return to Castle Drakenhof and study these books further. My sire will surely relinquish his claim once he witnesses my newfound power. If not... then he will suffer the same fate as the Devils of Swartzhafen.
These dunes still hide many treasures. My business is not concluded here.
Sylvania is presently of no concern. I must focus my efforts elsewhere.
Khazrak the One-Eye
The King of Bretonnia
The Briarmaven of Woe
The Ice Queen
This Beastlord brays loudly for all to hear. It is a sound of primal lust, a promise of many nights of rutting soon to come.
The Bretonnian begs you to strike off his head with his own blade, utterly convinced of the justification of the act.
A Dryad of the forests kneels before you, guised in the alluring form of a beautiful, lithe elf-maiden. It is said her skills of seduction rival even those of your own...
Kislev's Tzarina promises a night of wonder within her Ice Palace. She asks only that you grant her an heir.
Befoul the Waters
Taint the Air
Dump the contents of the Cauldron of a Thousand Poxes into the River Reik. The contagion will flow across the Empire, bringing death and misery to many.
Stoke the Plague Furnaces deep beneath their cities. The tainted air will waft up from the sewers, rendering the largest population centres almost uninhabitable.
Break His Mind
Bind His Body
Shatter Archaon's mind, leaving him as little more than a gibbering automaton who will wordlessly obey Vilitch's every command.
Carve his flesh with Tzeentchian runes of binding. His mind will remain intact, but he will be trapped within a body that answers only to the Curseling.
Cut Off His Head
Rip Out His Heart
With one deft blow, Valkia parts N'Kari's head from his shoulders. His skull will surely make a worthy offering to Khorne!
The Spear Slaupnir sings out, deftly plucking N'kari's heart from his chest. Valkia smiles as she bites into it, relishing the Greater Daemon's stolen strength.
Accept the Bargain
Reject the Bargain

Tears welling in his eyes, Helman abandons his quest, and farewells his brothers for what he knows is the last time. The Darkforged Vessel shatters, and the daemonic entity nestles itself within its new mortal shell.
“You lie, daemon! My brothers would never forsake me!”
The Folly of Malekith
Garamont's Triumph
Finubar's Lament
The Tale of Cylostra
A comic opera depicting Malekith's disastrous attempt to walk into the Flame of Asuryan. It will surely have her audience doubled over in fits of laughter!
This song was very popular in Cylostra's homeland of Bretonnia. It is a tale of triumph depicting Calarad of Garamont's victory over the fallen knight Merovech of Mousillon.
A sorrowful tale about an Everqueen's unfaithful heart. Cylostra sings it so beautifully that even the fish begin to weep.
A grand operatic performance complete with elaborate sets, costumed zombies, and even a cameo appearance by Cymbals, Cylostra's pet monkey.
The Southlands Crusade
The Badlands Crusade

Repanse raises her sword to the sky and declares that the Chevaliers de Lyonesse shall march south, into the sweltering jungles of the Southlands. The peasants whisper prayers and hold their trinkets close, for these lands are strongly reminiscent of Athel Loren back home.
Repanse levels her holy blade to the north, in the direction of the Badlands. The Bretonnians are no strangers to the Greenskins. A chance to strike at their homeland has them chomping at the bit.
